p: We could not assess why the use of transfusion reduced from 2010 to 2017; a potential explanation is that 2010 was an epidemic year, whereas 2017 was not. Some authors have suggested that in a dengue epidemic, ‘dengue panic syndrome’ may exist in which physicians tend to overestimate the platelet count as the sole condition to indicate transfusion [ 7, 31, 32]. Alternatively, we hypothesised that these changes occurred due to increased physician compliance with WHO guidelines, which disseminated more evidence regarding the importance and safety of not using prophylactic platelets in dengue [ 11, 33– 36].
